snippet: The Islamic State of Iraq and Syria, a Qaeda affiliate and onetime ally of Syrian insurgents, was routed from the eastern city of Raqqa, antigovernment activists said.
abstract: Internal war between Syrian insurgents and members of Islamic State of Iraq and Syria widens from parts of northern Syria into Raqqa, largest city in eastern Syria that had been under the group's control; some fighters affiliated with Al Qaeda have rejected the transnational jihadist group as too extreme.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad and Mohammad Ghannam from Beirut, Karam Shoumali from Istanbul, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The Islamic State of Iraq and Syria, a Qaeda affiliate and onetime ally of Syrian insurgents, was routed from the eastern city of Raqqa, antigovernment activists said.

headline.main: Rebel Infighting Spreads to an Eastern Syrian City
headline.print_headline: Rebel Infighting Spreads to an Eastern Syrian City
